article_title: After costly campaigns, much hangs in balance as Alaskans go to polls
article_text: Walker has said he'd expand Medicaid and stop the Alaska Stand Alone Pipeline, reversing Parnell policies in those areas. He has said as governor he would support SB 21, approved by voters Aug. 19, but closely watch it to make sure oil companies stabilize declining oil production over the long haul. Walker has also said he would complete the Alaska LNG project but said the state needs to more than double its proposed equity to 51 percent, a plan Parnell has said would kill the project.

article_metadata.description: Alaskans go to the polls Tuesday after the costliest election campaign in the states history. Voters will select the next governor, a U.S. senator and its lone representative in the U.S. House, as well as most state lawmakers, and will approve or reject measures to legalize marijuana, raise the minimum wage and limit the power of the citys public sector unions.

Voters will select the next governor, a U.S. senator and its lone representative in the U.S. House, as well as most state lawmakers, and will approve or reject measures to legalize marijuana, raise the minimum wage and limit the power of the citys public sector unions.
og.title: After costly campaigns, much hangs in balance as Alaskans go to polls

article_summary:
Walker has said he'd expand Medicaid and stop the Alaska Stand Alone Pipeline, reversing Parnell policies in those areas.
He has said as governor he would support SB 21, approved by voters Aug. 19, but closely watch it to make sure oil companies stabilize declining oil production over the long haul.
Walker has also said he would complete the Alaska LNG project but said the state needs to more than double its proposed equity to 51 percent, a plan Parnell has said would kill the project.
